title: Are essay writing help websites illegal or just unethical? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a student, it would be illegal to submit work that is not your own.As a website that offers assistance, like a tutor, that’s ethical if the student does the work and the tutor teaches.As a website writing on behalf of the student. The site is in the wrong too because they assisted the student to dishonor the code of conduct and regulations at the academic institution. Helping someone to do something illegal will never make it right. So by implication, they are committing a crime, even if their is no explicit law against such operation (yet).It is not a matter of being ‘just unethical’. Isn’t the constitution building on what is ethical? Law follows ethics. It’s not the other way around. Have you ever considered what the outcome will be to the value of a degree if the majority of students obtained a passing grade due to such fraudulent misconduct? The credibility of the degree and institution will crash, leaving innocent people to suffer because some people wanted the ‘reward’ without the ‘work’. Matilda Prinsloo's answer to Where do we draw the line of plagiarism in the work of fiction?

If it’s actually a “help”website, in which you submit your own original rough draft, get feedback from them for a fee, then revise and submit to the teacher, it’s both legal and ethical. However, the majority of such “help” websites write the paper for you and have you falsely put your name on it. This is typically unethical, but may or may not be illegal depending on where you live. A minority of such websites—the most dangerous ones—advertise that they will create an original essay upon request for students, but they then cut-and-paste material off the web somewhere and sell it to their rather obtuse customers. Since the materials they provide are technically under copyright by the original author, this sort of intellectual theft is both unethical and illegal.

Depends. Are tutors illegal or unethical? Same rules apply to these Web sites. If someone does all the work for you, and you simply submit it, that’s plagiarism and unethicalif you do a first draft and you work with the tutor to make it better, that’s fineIf the tutor/web site copy from others, that’s copyright infringement and plagiarism
